experience: You and Bryan both know Jason Patino, Kenny G Rhoads, and 3 others
You and Bryan are both in the Kforce Professional Network group

Recruiters:  I constantly see you making posts to defend your career, consistently saying recruitment gets a bad rap.   Verizon released a job today in what I would assume is a vendor management system, I have 10 e-mails left after already deleting 20 others.  On top of that my phone has over 30 voicemails for the exact same position, all swarming at me for this one role.   Agencies I have never spoken with, agencies with a lot of false promises; "We are the only vendor working this right now", "guaranteed 3 year duration", etc.  Not to mention the terrible grammar riddled throughout with some that didn't replace the template information.

This is why a lot of people disrespect recruiters because this happens DAILY, meaningless fluff, and almost all the e-mails you see below, plus the other 20 in the trash are all cut and paste for a job.  I know you think you mean well, but as any IT professional gets bombarded like this, do you really expect us to have any positive response or outlook when working with recruiters?

DISYS is an IT staffing and consulting company serving Fortune 500 and other global-scale enterprises worldwide. A unique hybrid technical services firm that does more than merely fill staffing requirements, DISYS delivers strategic value by understanding and responding to a client’s IT environment, problems and challenges either by assembling the most highly talented team for any job or delivering more comprehensive, cost-effective IT solutions

• Technical recruiter for the Miami & Ft. Lauderdale area, recruiting for clients such as Assurant, Interval International, Citrix, Carnival, Amadeus, and Ryder• Recruiting for technical skills including but not limited to Front-end web developers, Mobile developers, PHP Developers, Java Developers, Business Analysts, Quality Assurance Engineers, Project Managers and System Administrators • Involved in full life cycle recruiting which involved sourcing candidates all the way through redeploying candidates• Sourced and recruited qualified candidates utilizing the internal database, Monster, Dice, LinkedIn, and Google• Qualified candidates by conducting web interviews to gain work history, professional skills, education and salary requirements• Completed reference checks provided by candidates to ensure skills and professionalism expressed were accurate• Maintained an on-going relationship with pipeline candidates, current consultants and redeployable consultants• Coordinating applicable background investigations with administrative staff

recommendations: May 8, 2012, Chase worked with Bryan in different groups

Bryan Haegle is a terrific technology recruiter. He has a good eye for talent (If I don't say so myself), and does a remarkable job plugging professionals into the right positions. I wish all recruiters would take a lesson or two from his playbook. I highly recommend him to other internet engineers/developers such as myself in the market for enterprise-level employment.

I had the pleasure of training, mentoring, and working with Bryan from April 2011- November 2011.  Bryan is a head downs worker who has picked up on technology recruiting very quickly.  He absorbs new information and executes it to fullest.  He is a focused worker that does whatever it takes to get the job done.  Bryan is hard working, results oriented, and has a can-do attitude that has added value to the team.
